CaveIn.synopsis: Elevator gnome one-liner if you sent him to be with the others after the mutiny.

Saved.synopsis: Foul-mouthed elevator gnome has been saved and is now in the myconid circle.

individual_metadata.synopsis: Skickpit has a foul mouth to match the duergar. He runs their errands for them and brings them drinks. You can ask if he wants freed, attack him, or leave him be.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -606.315; 5.317; 382.6464. Speak to either of the 3 NPCS and wait for UND_ElevatorGuards options to leave.5. Speaker to Stickpit - Gnome.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: There is a branching sequence here. The unnamed session (its synopsis mentions 'Skickpit' and describes the initial encounter where you can choose to free, attack, or leave him) is the starting interaction. Depending on the choice made during that session, two different outcomes occur. If you choose to let him join the others after the mutiny, then the 'CaveIn' session is triggered later (as it is a one‐liner delivered once he is with the group). Alternatively, if you choose to save him, then the 'Saved' session is triggered, showing that he is now found as part of the myconid circle. Since these outcomes are mutually exclusive (the gnome cannot be both saved and sent to join the others), the 'CaveIn' and 'Saved' sessions cannot both occur in the same playthrough. In summary, the unnamed (Skickpit) session must occur before either 'CaveIn' or 'Saved', and the two outcomes are exclusive.

CaveIn_0.speaker: Skickpit
CaveIn_0.text: You've done more than I'd have hoped for. I should never have doubted.

Saved_0.speaker: Skickpit
Saved_0.text: Shit. Still can't believe you got me out of there. Sorry I told you to piss off.

Saved_1.speaker: Skickpit
Saved_1.text: Could use a stiff drink, if I'm being honest. The duergar ale wasn't half bad.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Go find somewhere to hide - wait for things to cool down.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Take the lift to the surface.

111.speaker: Skickpit
111.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: The curse is cleared. You'll be perfectly safe.

47.speaker: Skickpit
47.text: Well, you did me right once, so you earned my trust twice.

41.speaker: Skickpit
41.text: Won't be needing this poison, now that you've offed the pricks. Bet you'll find it handy, though.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gnome hands over poison vial.

127.speaker: Skickpit
127.text: You're a good one. I won't forget it.

124.speaker: Skickpit
124.text: Cleared - just like that, huh? Well I'm not taking the chance. Any other ideas?

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I go where I like. Move.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Just do it, before I cut out that profane tongue of yours.

58.speaker: Skickpit
58.text: Fine, fine - I'm not looking for more trouble.

120.speaker: Skickpit
120.text: Better that than chance the damn curse. You got a plan C?

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Grymforge is even more dangerous. Stay at your own peril.

2.speaker: Skickpit
2.text: As if I needed the reminder. I'll take my chances on the surface.

114.speaker: Skickpit
114.text: Down here I know what I'm dealing with. Up there, not so much. Got a better idea?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Trust me. Would a gnome steer you wrong?

26.speaker: Skickpit
26.text: Nah - not one who freed me from slavers, anyway. You did me right.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Go where you want. I've done enough for you.

31.speaker: Skickpit
31.text: Damn it - just when I thought you half decent.

68.speaker: Skickpit
68.text: I know a place, cross the lake. Should be safe.

121.speaker: Skickpit
121.text: You might be a shithead. But I'm grateful.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Beldron took the others across the lake. You should join them.

119.speaker: Skickpit
119.text: Really? Drugh yes. Glory to Ironhand!
119.context: NodeContext: Absolutely relieved / Drugh = an epithet. DROOG

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Beldron is taking the others across the lake. Wait for them there.

59.speaker: Skickpit
59.text: Beldron's safe, then? Thank Ironhand. I'll make my way over.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: The others are free. Meet them at the dig site.

44.speaker: Skickpit
44.text: Free? Glory to Ironhand! I'll join the others.

13.speaker: Skickpit
13.text: Off with you. They'll get suspicious.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: It's pronounced: 'I tremble afore your awful majesty.'

50.speaker: Skickpit
50.text: I can call you other silly names, True Soul. Like arserag, or shitepot.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Hey now. What's with the hostility?

55.speaker: Skickpit
55.text: I heard the pisspot - you're a True Soul, same as Nere. Traitor to your kind.

33.speaker: Skickpit
33.text: I heard the pisspot - you're a True Soul, same as Nere.

7.speaker: Skickpit
7.text: So like I said: piss off.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: No, you don't understand. Thulla sent me to save you.

28.speaker: Skickpit
28.text: Hah! Thulla was mad as a rutting badger, but she weren't a friend of any True Soul.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Say that to me one more time, and I'll gut you.

83.speaker: Skickpit
83.text: Is that so? Well listen close, True Soul - I've got a new tune to whistle.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I'm working so hard to be a nice person these days but you're really trying my patience.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: My name's [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I'm not really a True Soul.

38.speaker: Skickpit
38.text: You're a True Soul, all right. You look it. You smell it.

65.speaker: Skickpit
65.text: So listen close. I won't say it again.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Last chance. You want me to kill your slavers or not?

113.speaker: Skickpit
113.text: What about 'piss off' do you - hold on. You aren't just talking shit, are you?
113.context: NodeContext: Voice lowers when he realises player is offering to help

5.speaker: Skickpit
5.text: Then shh - keep it low. Don't let them hear you.

35.speaker: Skickpit
35.text: You want to play hero, Blade? I'm not complaining.

52.speaker: Skickpit
52.text: Now - why in the hottest hells would a True Soul be helping me?

8.speaker: Player
8.text: That's the thing - I'm not really a True Soul.

40.speaker: Skickpit
40.text: Fine - let's say I believe you. You want to kill these peckers, I'm not complaining.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: I told you. I'm not really a True Soul.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: It doesn't matter. Do you want my help or not?

100.speaker: Skickpit
100.text: Fine. You want to spill their guts, I won't stand in the way.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: What can I say? I just love killing.

24.speaker: Skickpit
24.text: Figures. You want blood? Those pisspots will spill plenty.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: No one should serve a master. You deserve to be free.

69.speaker: Skickpit
69.text: Free? From your mouth, I hope. Go on, then - split them open. I'm not gonna stop you.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: They look like they'd put up a good fight.

75.speaker: Skickpit
75.text: They're thick and scrappy, no doubt. If fighting's your vice, I'm not gonna stop you.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'm in the mood for a little slaughter.

14.speaker: Skickpit
14.text: You do look the sort. Well - if you're craving blood, better theirs than mine.

23.speaker: Skickpit
23.text: But you better finish the job, 'cause I'll be the one to suffer if you don't.

32.speaker: Skickpit
32.text: Ahem. Ain't you hearin' me, prick-hole? Piss off to every last hell!
32.context: NodeContext: Suddenly loud, so nearby duergar will overhear him.

19.speaker: Skickpit
19.text: Whatever sick game this is I want nothing to do with it. Get the hells away from me.

104.speaker: Skickpit
104.text: That's the best comeback you've got? Amateur.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: How about we show these slavers what deep gnomes are made of, instead?

117.speaker: Skickpit
117.text: Shit. You aren't just talking from your arse, eh?

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: Think this through. Strike a slave, and its owners will not simply stand by.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: Careful - attack a slave, and you might have to answer to the slave master.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Hang on. You sure you want to pick a fight with these gnomes? They've got bigger problems than us.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: You're not going to let him talk to you like that, are you?

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: Cool it. You think you'd be any less mouthy if slavers took you hostage?

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Hold on. This fellow may deserve it, but I don't think the duergar will appreciate you hurting the merchandise.

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *A shred of doubt gives you pause. Attack the gnome, and his owners are sure to defend him.*

105.speaker: Player
105.text: You look like you're in trouble. Surely I can help you.

125.speaker: Skickpit
125.text: You want to help me? Then open those ears and listen close.

46.speaker: Skickpit
46.text: You're all the same. I'd sooner spit in your shitter than trust a single damn word.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Listen, I'm here to help. Play along.

74.speaker: Skickpit
74.text: And who asked for help? Why don't you - hold on. You're talking true, aren't you?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: They call me the Blade of Frontiers. I'm not a True Soul - I can help you.

87.speaker: Skickpit
87.text: The Blade of... well, shit. You're really him, aren't you?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I'll need you to repeat that.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: No need to be rude. I'm on your side.

96.speaker: Skickpit
96.text: My side? I heard the pisspot. You're a True Soul, same as Nere.

109.speaker: Skickpit
109.text: Didn't you hear me the first time? Piss. Off.
